reviews.review: A number of the problems that both JJ Abrams and Rian Johnson created in episodes 7 and 8 were cleared up in the movie.  The character, Rose Tico, was ridiculous throughout the trilogy.  A lowly mechanic, to fighter pilot, to foot soldier??  A waste of screen time and was not a "lead actress" as billed.  The movie also introduced another new force power, that was ridiculous.
A little long, a lot to take in. Like other Star Wars movies, some good, some bad. But overall a fantastic movie if you are a fan of this universe!
This movies was great. Don't listen to the negativity! Make up your own mind. I will go see it again today.
Dont listen to the critics, if you enjoyed the previous films this is more of the same and does a great job wrapping it all up.

I think this movie was a pretty good ending to the Skywalker saga, however it does have it's faults, for one I personally think the main story was a little bit cluttered, especially at the end, it felt like there were too many ''twists'' at the end. The Rise of Skywalker is hugely different compared to The Last Jedi, I think having two different directors is the main reason why this trilogy wasn't as well reviewed as it could have been, JJ Abram's vision was completely set of course by Rian Johnson's. It is very obvious to me whilst I was watching this movie that JJ Abrams ''fixed'' storylines Rian Johnson had set up, I did like the direction this movie went in but thought the ending wasn't as satisfying as it could have been.
86% is a lie!!!! Do not go see!!! Save your money!!!
Brought it all together.    As good as the original  42 yrs ago
Brought everything to a close. An entire saga over decades now comes to a close.. Great job on this movie!
And i thought TLJ was bad...

The plot doesn't make any sense. People keep coming up with new magic powers. The series was killed a movie ago with the merry Poppins fly through space, you can't fix what's broken so badly, but you can sure drag it for another 3 hours to promote your new ride in Disney park.
